Lonely Road #142, How to take a perfect ass photo

Posted on January 24, 2014 by mike

 

LOL…how’s that for a title? Well, any of you who’ve followed my blog and my Lonely Road project probably know that I’ve had plenty of opportunities to photograph some gorgeous girls and some truly gorgeous butts! Yeah, you’d think I’d be the master of the butt photo by this point, right? Well….I figure I’d give you all a quick run through of what I think the KEY components are to taking a really good booty shot…just to emphasize my perspective and to make sure I properly “arm” each of you to go out and try this for yourself!

Oh..and one important tip:  It’s hard to take any small, flat  bottom and make it look round! Yeah, you can mess with angles and cheat through photoshop…but, you may be challenged without the proper subject matter. You can’t make a mountain from a mole hill!  But, before I get too far in front of myself… let me introduce you to my immaculately gorgeous friend, Cheyenne! She’s the butt-owner for my little blog entry today, but, she’s also an artist, a friend, and someone who can model way more than just a beautiful rear end. But, since that’s the subject matter for today, enjoy her stunning face while you can:

Wow…I just find her strikingly beautiful! Now, get ahold of her in some vivid tights and a matching throw:

You’ve got to love how dramatically the fuscia contrasts to the desert landscape and sky behind her. To me, sharp contrast and vivid coloring both can play a huge part in an artistic photograph! Now, take that gorgeous lady in that fuscia outfit and watch her jump:

Motion …as you all know…is another component of “art “for me. And, seeing a gorgeous body in flight brings a whole additional element to an already interesting photo. But…man, oh, man…..I’ve got to get back to the priority at hand: A perfect butt photo!

OK…how about another those version of Cheyenne and her tights from the side:

You clearly get the feel that she is gifted with some incredibly strong legs and a very prominent rear end. But, as I hope to show you, a lot has to do with angles, lighting, shadows and how the model even stands. Case in point:

As she turned away from the camera, you can see that Cheyenne has quite a round behind… covered up by those tights. But, this isn’t necessarily a very flattering perspective of her. Why?? Yeah…because her butt’s not naked!!   No, the truth is that this higher angle sort of compresses her and makes her look more compact. Also, it’s such a rigid pose. She’s begun to twist around though her feet still point forward. Just not a flattering pose for her.

So, now checkout this lady taking a brief break back at my Pathfinder:

As you can clearly see, she’s blessed with a bubble butt and you’d think it would be easy to take a complimentary photo of Cheyenne and that ass of hers. But, I still figure I can mess it up:

Yup! Sure did!  Well, by having her bottom directly in front of me I’m keeping it in more of 2 dimensional perspective than 3D. And, with overhead lighting, there’s no shadowing, and everything seems to just flatten and widen out! Sad…because it’s not hard to make this picture a LOT better. Sorry…Cheyenne. Let me try again:

Hey, now! Your boy here is making some progress! Jeez…just getting that bit of a twist from her, having me position myself slightly more to her side…..and in this situation RAISING the camera angle…makes all the difference in the world. Hello, Cheyenne and HELLO to that fabulous ass of yours we’d momentarily lost track of! Our model also has a bit of a sultry look which clearly helps…but, I wonder what else we can do to enhance the shot?

In this case, I dropped my camera angle a bit lower and as a result her ass just JUMPS out! Wow…a bit more twist, a better shadow to highlight those round cheeks…..it’s pretty good, wouldn’t you agree? Angle of the shot, shadow and lighting, twisting properly….several things you need to keep track of.

What do you think about this one? An even lower camera angle, a more pronounced twist in her hips..but I’m not sure I like it better than the previous shot?!?!  The added twist does seemingly narrow her hips further, but Cheyenne doesn’t really need to do that as she’s so lean and thin in her hips already. So, personally, I think I’d stick with the first of these two shots, myself.

Now….take a look at two very similar shots and see what you think the biggest differences are between them. Which do you prefer and why?

What does it for me is her proper posture and the resulting shadow! In the first shot, Cheyenne is leaning a bit forward, her right hand is raised a bit,  and the result is a lot of direct light on both her bottom and her hip. But, in the second shot, since she’s more upright and has dropped that right hand, the shadow just touches the top of her cheeks and thus her ass is totally highlighted and contrasted to the darker colors around it! I love it when the shadows can frame your focal point…and, in this case, for me, that second picture is just bootilcious perfecto sensational!

Well….I think Cheyenne agrees :

Oh, yeah! Even the model has a right to celebrate when things finally go right….even if her wardrobe doesn’t fully cooperate.

Well….do you think you now have a better understanding of what it takes to create the perfect picture of an ass?

If so….is this what you had in mind?

This photograph… truly of a “complete ass”… probably isn’t what you had in mind as a way to wrap up Cheyenne’s shoot, right? But….when your mind is on asses….well….thoughts can wonder at times.

Instead, I’d like you to see a rather unique shot from the MG Imagery portals! I don’t often do “studio” shooting, as I’m much more comfortable in direct, natural lighting. But, Cheyenne did also work with me back at my house at the end of our day on the Lonely Road…and we did create what I consider to be the nearly perfect ass shot. A photograph of a bottom taken at the ideal angle, with the best lighting and shadows, a little depth of field even……where I don’t look for possible ways to improve it. Are you ready? Well…..here you go:

Cheyenne. Boots. Booty. Perfection.

Even big ole Rush Limbaugh might control his warped perspective, crack a smile, and start to hyperventilate and/or sweat when he sees this picture!

Go, Cheyenne!!

And, how ’bout a nice round of applause for a democratic, artistic gal with a great behind…….. and, her ability to patiently “bare” with me as I attempted to create, over and over and over again……

THE PERFECT ASS SHOT!

See you soon…..
